Validator memory:
- Slice Moves: M2 E2 S2
- Edge Flip and Corner Twist: UF flip, URF twist on ε
- Edge case 1: L2 D R′ D′ F′ D′ R D′ R2 F2
- Edge case 2: L2 D R′ D′ F′ D′ R D′ R2 F2
- Corner case 1: L2 D R′ D′ F′ D′ R D′ R2 F2
- Corner case 2: L2 D R′ D′ F′ D′ R D′ R2 F2
- Corner case 3: L2 D R′ D′ F′ D′ R D′ R2 F2
- No Reassembly Needed: R2 B2 F R2 D2 F′ U2 F′ D2 L2 D2 U′ B2 L R′ D U F U′ R F
- Mystery Case 1: Corner case 1 on R2 B2 F R2 D2 F′ U2 F′ D2 L2 D2 U′ B2 L R′ D U F U′ R F
- Mystery Case 2: Edge case 2 on R2 B2 F R2 D2 F′ U2 F′ D2 L2 D2 U′ B2 L R′ D U F U′ R F
- Mystery Case 3: Edge case 1 on R2 B2 F R2 D2 F′ U2 F′ D2 L2 D2 U′ B2 L R′ D U F U′ R F
- Mystery Case 4: Corner case 3 on R2 B2 F R2 D2 F′ U2 F′ D2 L2 D2 U′ B2 L R′ D U F U′ R F
- Mystery Case 5: Corner case 2 on R2 B2 F R2 D2 F′ U2 F′ D2 L2 D2 U′ B2 L R′ D U F U′ R F

I have solved this, and have voted to approve. Nice puzzle.

I made a few minor modifications to the Statement to correct / clarify the grammar in some places.

Note: the validator names are too revealing for publication, but we kind of need them around for minor corrections while the puzzle is still pending.

Third person who intends to approve: please notify me (just answer here) so I can finalize them.

The logical step up “I just peel the stickers off!” (https://www.codingame.com/contributions/view/4470b5b116b9b9c20189405f6584682e08d)

The next step is all too obvious ;-)
